verses.verse: (1 Against Israel and his idols.14 His destruction for the same.) Israel is a (Whereof though the grapes were gathered, yet ever as it gathered new strength, it increased new wickedness, so that the correction which should have brought them to obedience, did but utter their stubbornness.) empty vine, yet hath it brought forth fruit unto itself, and according to the multitude of the fruit thereof he hath increased the altars: according to the (As they were rich and had abundance.) goodness of their land they have made fair images.
Their heart is (To wit, from God.) divided: now shall they be found faulty: he shall break down their altars; he shall destroy their images.

For now they shall say, We have no (The day shall come that God shall take away their king, and then they shall feel the fruit of their sins, and how they trusted in him in vain, 2 Kings 17:6, 7.) King because we feared not the Lord: and what should a King do to us?

They have spoken words, swearing falsely in making (In promising to be faithful toward God.) a covenant: thus (Thus their integrity and fidelity, which they pretended, was nothing but bitterness and grief.) judgment groweth as wormwood in the furrows of the field.

The inhabitants of Samaria shall (When the calf shall be carried away.) fear because of the calf of Beth Aven: for the people thereof shall mourn over it, and the (Chemarims were certain idolatrous priests, which did wear black apparel in their sacrifices, and cried with a loud voice: which superstition Elijah derided, 1 Kings 18:27, read 2 Kings 23:5.) Chemarims thereof, that rejoiced on it for the glory thereof, because it is departed from it.
It shall be also brought to Assyria, for a present unto king Jareb: Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
Of Samaria, the king thereof is destroyed, as the foam upon the water.

The high places also of (This he speaketh in contempt of Bethel, read Hos. 4:15.) Aven shall be destroyed, even the sin of Israel: the thorn and the thistle shall grow upon their altars, and they shall say to the mountains, (Cross references: : Isa. 2:19; Luke 23:30; Rev. 6:16; Rev. 9:6) Cover us, and to the hills, Fall upon us.

O Israel, thou hast (In those days wast thou as wicked as the Gibeonites, as God there partly declared: for thy zeal could not be good in executing Godâ€™s judgments, seeing thine own deeds were as wicked as theirs.) sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they (To wit, to fight, or the Israelites remained in that stubbornness from that time.) stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity did not (The Israelites were not moved by their example to cease from their sins.) touch them.

It is my desire (Because they are so desperate, I will delight to destroy them.) that I should chastise them, and the people shall be gathered against them, when they shall gather themselves in their two (That is, when they have gathered all their strength together.) furrows.

And Ephraim is as a heifer used to delight in (Wherein is pleasure, as in plowing is labor and pain.) threshing: but I will pass by her (I will lay my yoke upon her fat neck.) fair neck: I will make Ephraim to ride: Judah shall plow, and Jacob shall break his clods.
Sow to yourselves in righteousness: reap after the measure of mercy: (Read Jer. 4:4.) break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the Lord, till he come and rain righteousness upon you.
But you have plowed wickedness: ye have reaped iniquity: you have eaten the fruit of lies: because thou didst trust in thine own ways, and in the multitude of thy strong men,

Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy people, and all thy munitions shall be destroyed, as (That is, Shalmaneser in the destruction of that city spared neither kind nor age.) Shalman destroyed Beth Arbel in the day of battle: the mother with the children was dashed in pieces.
So shall Bethel do unto you, because of your malicious wickedness: in a morning shall the king of Israel be destroyed.
